title: Advanced Social Sector Competency Development Course Through Synchronous Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment combining synchronous online (webinar) and offline activities for advanced social sciences study at the graduate level

learning_goals: Critical thinking skills for analyzing complex social phenomena are enhanced in synchronous online environments

Learners will collaborate with 3–4 peers using webinar platforms (Zoom, Microsoft Teams, etc.) to create a project proposal (including goals, methodology, expected outcomes) for solving social issues within 2 weeks and submit it meeting peer and instructor evaluation criteria (≥3 points per item on a 5-point scale).
Self-efficacy related to social issues is improved by 30% or more in real-time online discussions

Learners will apply social issue analysis and problem-solving methodologies (e.g., data-driven approaches, stakeholder mapping) acquired in blended learning environments to select one real community issue (e.g., aging population response, lack of public spaces) per 3–5-member team, submit project deliverables (problem definition, solution proposal, implementation plan) within 3 weeks, and achieve ≥12/15 points on an evaluation rubric (problem definition clarity, solution creativity, feasibility).

resources: Access to social sciences specialized databases

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
